did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Office of Diversity and Inclusion Records1970-2017
did.abstract: Records of the Office of Diversity and Inclusion and its predecessors. Materials include administrative correspondence, committee and task force meeting materials, planning documentation, and assorted reports, all relating to issues of diversity, inclusion, equal employment, and discrimination.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office dates from the establishment of an Affirmative Action Program in 1971 in the Office of Personnel. Previous titles include; Office of Equal Employment Opportunity, Affirmative Action Office, and Office of Diversity and Affirmative Action. Currently called the Office of Diversity and Inclusion, it is responsible for providing diversity-related training and resources, addressing discrimination and harassment complaints, and consulting on recruiting and hiring.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection includes affirmative action and recruitment plans; student surveys; workforce analysis documents; conference materials; daily correspondence (1974-1986); Federal compliance reports (1971); task force and committee materials including: the Women's Concerns Committee (1978-2000), the Black Action Coalition, and others. Topics covered include: Section 504 (which addresses disability discrimination), Title IX, and equal employment.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
